burlap.datastructures

Class BoltzmannDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.datastructures.BoltzmannDistribution

  • public class BoltzmannDistribution
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods for computing, sampling, and working with Boltzmann distributions/Softmax. The input is a set of "preference" values. The output is a probability distribution over those preferences with elements that had higher preferences having higher probability. Computation is performed using a log sum exponential re-expression trick that avoids overflow errors.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

      The random object to use for sampling.
      protected double temperature
      The temperature value.
      protected double[] tempNormalized
      The preference values normalized by the temperature

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoltzmannDistribution(double[] preferences)
      Initializes the distribution with the preference values that are to be turned into a soft max probability distribution.
      BoltzmannDistribution(double[] preferences, double temperature)
      Initializes the distribution with the preference values that are to be turned into a soft max probability distribution and a temperature value to control how deterministic the probability output is.

    • Field Detail

      • preferences

        protected double[] preferences
        The preference values to turn into probabilities

      • temperature

        protected double temperature
        The temperature value. Lower values produce more greedy deterministic probability outputs while higher values produce more uniform probability outputs

      • tempNormalized

        protected double[] tempNormalized
        The preference values normalized by the temperature

        The output probabilities

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoltzmannDistribution

        public BoltzmannDistribution(double[] preferences)
        Initializes the distribution with the preference values that are to be turned into a soft max probability distribution.
        Parameters:
        preferences - the preference values to turn into a probability distribution

      • BoltzmannDistribution

        public BoltzmannDistribution(double[] preferences,
                     double temperature)
        Initializes the distribution with the preference values that are to be turned into a soft max probability distribution and a temperature value to control how deterministic the probability output is. Lower temperature values result in a more deterministic distribution; higher values produce a more uniform distribution.
        Parameters:
        preferences - the preference values to turn into a probability distribution
        temperature - a value on 0 < temperature < +infinity

        public double[] getProbabilities()
